1.title: So you want to talk about race
1.subtitle: Ijeoma Oluo guides readers of all races through subjects ranging from intersectionality and affirmative action to "model minorities" in an attempt to make the seemingly impossible possible: honest conversations about race and racism, and how they infect almost every aspect of American life.

1.title: Center for Policing Equity
1.subtitle: Your donation fuels our ability to lead on the police reform that's necessary. Together we will create a public safety system that protects and preserves justice for all.

2.title: Remembering Henry Lewis, first Black conductor of a major symphony orchestra
2.subtitle: Henry Lewis’ love and passion for music and symphony was indescribable.

products.name: Oatmeal and Spice Moisturizing Body Bar

3.title: What Is Juneteenth?
3.subtitle: Juneteenth (short for “June Nineteenth”) marks the day when federal troops arrived in Galveston, Texas in 1865 to take control of the state and ensure that all enslaved people be freed. The troops’ arrival came a full two and a half years after the signing of the Emancipation Proclamation. Juneteenth honors the end to slavery in the United States and is considered the longest-running African American holiday.

3.title: Nia the Loc God
3.subtitle: A natural oil that your hair will love. You are one step closer to moisturized, shiny, healthy hair that smells amazing.

products.name: Loc God Stimulating Oil 4oz
products.description: This stimulating oils is the perfect item to add to your haircare routine. 100% natural, also smells 100% like lemongrass essential oils.  This product is extremely light and will leave your scalp itch free.

products.name: The Loc God Hydration Mist 9oz
products.description: This hydration mist is the perfect item to add to your haircare routine. 100% natural, also smells 100% like lavender essential oils.  This product will leave your hair super soft and give you an extra boost of hydration and shine.

products.description: Deep cleansing shampoo, with a luxurious smell that will leave your hair clean and not feeling stripped. This shampoo is 100% natural. It will help with dandruff, irritated and or itchy scalp.

4.title: What Happened on May 25th?
4.subtitle: On May 25th, 2020, George Floyd was in Minneapolis on business, far from his family and community, when four Minneapolis police officers murdered him in broad daylight. It was a modern day lynching as those police officers served as judge, jury, and executioner on an unarmed, non-violent, handcuffed Black man.

4.title: What If I Don't Move to the Back of the Bus?
4.subtitle: Rosa Parks brought together a unique blend of life experiences, a commitment to racial justice, and a flawless reputation to transform a single act of defiance into a defining moment for the modern American civil rights movement.

5.title: 360 Magazine
5.subtitle:
360 is an edgy fashion, lifestyle and culture magazine. We will introduce cutting-edge brands, entities and trends to tastemakers within their respective communities. Our founding members have over 30 years of collective experience both as notable talent and uber professionals within the realm of fashion, music, art, design and entertainment. We are more than just a magazine comprised of journalists, representing a movement of social awareness and change.

We are a LGBTQIA friendly publication. The magazine is contemporary in look and appeal. Quality art content is the constant goal. The magazine will be entertaining, newsworthy and thought-provoking. It will appeal to a broad entertainment readership. No magazine like it is available today, constantly celebrating racial and sexual ambiguous talent and artists.

5.title: All Hip-Hop
5.subtitle:
AllHipHop.com was founded and launched in 1998 by CEO’s "Grouchy" Greg Watkins and Chuck "Jigsaw" Creekmur.

After many years of developing the site, AllHipHop.com has become a valuable resource for hip-hop on the internet, featuring daily news, interviews, reviews, multimedia, a fast growing community and other interesting content.

Publications such as CNN, The Source, XXL, Complex, New York Post, The New York Times and many others cite AllHipHop.com’s news and features due to our accuracy and trustworthiness.

6.title: Does racism affect how you vote?
6.subtitle: Nate Silver has data that answers big questions about race in politics. For instance, in the 2008 presidential race, did Obama's skin color actually keep him from getting votes in some parts of the country? Stats and myths collide in this fascinating talk that ends with a remarkable insight.

6.title: Tyre Nichols Memorial Fund
6.subtitle: This fundraiser will help cover the costs of mental health services for Tyre Nichols' parents and  time off from their jobs. Additionally, they want to build a memorial skate park for Tyre, in honor of his love for skating and sunsets.

7.title: Harriet Tubman - Biography
7.subtitle: Harriet Tubman was an escaped enslaved woman who became a "conductor" on the Underground Railroad, leading enslaved people to freedom before the Civil War, all while carrying a bounty on her head. But she was also a nurse, a Union spy and a women’s suffrage supporter.

7.title: Hiram Rhodes Revels - Biography
7.subtitle: A freeman his entire life, Hiram Rhodes Revels was the first African American to serve in the U.S. Congress. With his moderate political orientation and oratorical skills honed from years as a preacher, Revels filled a vacant seat in the United States Senate in 1870.

8.title: Amanda Gorman Inauguration Poem
8.subtitle: Watch and read the youngest poet laureate, Amanda Gorman, recite her poem "The Hill We Climb"

9.title: A.O. Hamer
9.subtitle:
Hey, I'm Aramis and I love color!

My acrylic paintings are inspired by divine femininity, music, higher consciousness, and the cosmos. Liberation is my life's work- to free myself from the chains that could hold me back mentally, physically, and spiritually. My paintbrush reminds me of the creative power I have within the canvas - and life. As I take this journey to freedom, I hope to inspire others along the way.

10.title: Abolish Prison Labor in the USA
10.subtitle: Prison labor is a form of modern American slavery used by multiple large corporations across the world. Under the 13th Amendment to the United States Constitution, slavery was merely reformed rather than abolished. Racial justice in the USA cannot be achieved until prison labor is abolished completely.

14.title: Text a bot for book suggestions

products.name: Princess Omalie Doll – Gala Edition

As a treat, she holds a special key as your invitation to unlock the magic of her kingdom.

products.name: Princess Omalie, The Coronation And The Polka Dot Lamb
products.description: Princess Omalie of the African kingdom of IgboOrai could be the happiest girl on the planet — except that her family has been under a curse. Unless the curse of the Goliath beetle necklace is lifted, Omalie’s father might die in a horrible freak accident. He might never be crowned king. Omalie worries about her family, and about her own safety; how will she ever lead a peaceful happy life, have friends, and go to school?

17.title: Kids Swag
17.subtitle: Great action is taking place to improve diversity in books and dolls and there are a number of different vendors making it easier to find these great items. But what about everything else in your child's world? You go grocery shopping, what image is on the cute plate and cup set your child wants? You're want to encourage their creativity, what images are in their colouring books? You're throwing a birthday party, what are your options?
17.moreInfo: The list can go on and on. It is an unnecessarily complicated task to source and purchase everyday lifestyle products for children that have black images. These companies exist but one must be internet savvy and social media literate to find them. KIDS SWAG was launched in December 2016 to make it easy for parents to build environments that are reflective of their child's beauty.

products.name: Nia Ballerina Backpack
products.description: This beautifully illustrated pink rucksack is the perfect accessory for your little ballerina, which is both lightweight and practical with plenty of storage. 22.title: The Hate U Give
22.subtitle: Based on the best-selling novel, The Hate U Give tells the story of Starr Carter, who lives in two worlds: the poor, black neighborhood where she resides and the mostly white prep school she attends. This uneasy balance is shattered when she witnesses the fatal shooting of her childhood friend by a policeman. Facing pressures from all sides, Starr must find her voice and stand up for what’s right.

22.title: Sha'Carri Richardson's drug test suspension is the end result of racist policies
22.subtitle: Sha’Carri Richardson should have been spending the next month preparing to win the Olympic gold medal in the 100-meter dash. She had a shot after blazing through the event’s qualifying race last month in under 11 seconds. Instead, Richardson may not get to run at all in Tokyo after failing a drug test taken during the Olympic trials in Oregon. But it wasn’t a performance-enhancer that was in her system: It was marijuana.

28.title: Big Mama's Sauce
28.subtitle: We believe that to be the best we must use only the best ingredients. This homemade recipe has been the highlight of our family gatherings since at least 2002…honestly Big Mama can’t even remember, that’s how long she been making it! Big Mama never liked store bought sauce and she wanted to serve only the best to her loved ones. So here we are…on the store shelf ironically! Lol…We hope you taste only love and enjoy just as our family has for all of these years!

products.description: A great cotton necktie - in a beautiful design and color scheme = priceless! Grab yours now. Get compliments later...

products.name: Mauve Blossom Pocket Square
products.description: Handcrafted 100% fine cotton pocket square. Measures aprox 10" x 10"

products.name: 4 Layer Beet Bracelet
products.description: The perfect bracelet can add the finishing touch to your outfit. The smallest details often say the most. Add this stylish accessory to your collection.

30.title: Code Switch Podcast
30.subtitle: Hosted by journalists of color, our podcast tackles the subject of race head-on. We explore how it impacts every part of society — from politics and pop culture to history, sports and everything in between. This podcast makes ALL OF US part of the conversation — because we're all part of the story.

30.title: Oprah Winfrey's Cecil B. DeMille Award Acceptance Speech - 2018 Golden Globe Awards
30.subtitle: Watch Oprah Winfrey's 2018 Golden Globe Awards acceptance speech for the Cecil B. DeMille Award.

31.title: Justice For Tony McDade
31.subtitle: Tony McDade was a transgender black man who got killed by police in Tallahassee. Sign this petition and encourage others to do so as well to get his name out there.

31.title: Let Sha'Carri Run!
31.subtitle: Sign the petition to reinstate Sha'Carri Richardson and allow this world-class athlete to compete in the 100-meter dash! And revisit the outdated rules around marijuana and athletes.
